sen.j: 林遠里（はやし おんり、1831年3月8日（天保2年1月24日（旧暦）） - 1906年（明治39年）1月30日）は、福岡県生まれの老農（篤農家）・農業技術指導者。
sen.e: Onri HAYASHI (March 3, 1831 - January 30, 1906) was a Rono (Tokunoka [a well-experienced, exemplary good farmer]) and leader of agricultural techniques, who was born in Fukuoka Prefecture.
Onri HAYASHI (March 3, 1831 - January 30, 1906) was a Rono (Tokunoka [a well-experienced, exemplary good farmer]) and leader of agricultural techniques, who was born in Fukuoka Prefecture.
Onri HAYASHI (March 3, 1831 - January 30, 1906) was a Rono (Tokunoka [a well-experienced, exemplary good farmer]) and leader of agricultural techniques, who was born in Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 私塾・興産社・勧農社の創始者としても知られる。
sen.e: He was also known as a founder of private schools, Kosansha and Kannosha.
He was also known as a founder of private schools, Kosansha and Kannosha.
He was also known as a founder of private schools, Kosansha and Kannosha.

sen.j: 林遠里の考案した農法は、筑前農法または福岡農法と呼ばれ、寒水浸法、土囲い法、冬蒔き畑苗代法をその中核としながら、多労を旨とした集約的農業技術により土地生産性を高める一方で、抱持立犂を装備した牛馬耕を導入することによって耕耘作業を省力化し、労働生産性を高めるというものであった。
sen.e: The agricultural methods devised by Onri HAYASHI was called Chikuzen noho (Chikuzen farming method) or Fukuoka noho (Fukuoka farming method), which introduced Kansui shinho (soaking seeds in water during winter), Tsuchigakoi-ho (keeping seeds in soil during winter) and Fuyumaki hata nawashiro-ho (sowing seeds in non-irrigated rice nursery in winter) as its core methods, and while improving land productivity with work-intensive agricultural techniques, it increased labor productivity by saving tillage works using cattle equipped with Kakaemottatesuki (a kind of Japanese plow without sole).

The agricultural methods devised by Onri HAYASHI was called Chikuzen noho (Chikuzen farming method) or Fukuoka noho (Fukuoka farming method), which introduced Kansui shinho (soaking seeds in water during winter), Tsuchigakoi-ho (keeping seeds in soil during winter) and Fuyumaki hata nawashiro-ho (sowing seeds in non-irrigated rice nursery in winter) as its core methods, and while improving land productivity with work-intensive agricultural techniques, it increased labor productivity by saving tillage works using cattle equipped with Kakaemottatesuki (a kind of Japanese plow without sole).

The agricultural methods devised by Onri HAYASHI was called Chikuzen noho (Chikuzen farming method) or Fukuoka noho (Fukuoka farming method), which introduced Kansui shinho (soaking seeds in water during winter), Tsuchigakoi-ho (keeping seeds in soil during winter) and Fuyumaki hata nawashiro-ho (sowing seeds in non-irrigated rice nursery in winter) as its core methods, and while improving land productivity with work-intensive agricultural techniques, it increased labor productivity by saving tillage works using cattle equipped with Kakaemottatesuki (a kind of Japanese plow without sole).

sen.j: この筑前農法は明治農法の中核的な農法として、全国に広まった。
sen.e: This Chikuzen noho spread throughout the county as the core method of the Meiji noho (generic name for farming methods in the Meiji period that systematized conventional agricultural techniques, in contrast to modern agricultural techniques).

This Chikuzen noho spread throughout the county as the core method of the Meiji noho (generic name for farming methods in the Meiji period that systematized conventional agricultural techniques, in contrast to modern agricultural techniques).

This Chikuzen noho spread throughout the county as the core method of the Meiji noho (generic name for farming methods in the Meiji period that systematized conventional agricultural techniques, in contrast to modern agricultural techniques).

sen.j: 林遠里の墓地は入部地域にあり、2005年には、林遠里100年際が行われ、当時の入部小学校の4年生（2クラス）が田植えに参加した。
sen.e: The grave of Onri HAYASHI was in Irube region, where the 100th death anniversary of Onri HAYASHI was held in 2005 and the fourth grade students (for two classrooms) at Irube elementary school of the time joined rice planting.
sen.cmt: (100年)際→(100年)祭 として訳しました。
sen.e: The grave of Onri HAYASHI was in Irube region, where the 100th death anniversary of Onri HAYASHI was held in 2005 and the fourth grade students (for two classrooms) at Irube elementary school of the time joined rice planting.

The grave of Onri HAYASHI was in Irube region, where the 100th death anniversary of Onri HAYASHI was held in 2005 and the fourth grade students (for two classrooms) at Irube elementary school of the time joined rice planting.

sen.j: 来歴・業績
sen.e: Biography and Personal Profile
Biography and Achievements
sen.cmt: Personal Profile→原文に近いAchievementsに訂正しました。
sen.e: Biography and Achievements

sen.j: 1831年 福岡藩士・銃術指南役林直内の次男として早良郡福岡市に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1831, he was born in Fukuoka City, Sawara County, as the second son of 林直内, a feudal retainer of Fukuoka Domain and instructor of gun shooting.
sen.cmt: 林直内→林直内[正しい読み方が不明です]早良郡福岡市→”早良郡（福岡市）”かとも思われますが、原文通り訳しました。
sen.e: In 1831, he was born in Fukuoka City, Sawara County, as the second son of Chokunai HAYASHI, a feudal retainer of Fukuoka Domain and instructor of gun shooting.
sen.cmt: 林直内→Chokunai HAYASHIに訂正しました。http://www.fuku-c.ed.jp/schoolhp/elirube/page5.html参照しました。
sen.e: In 1831, he was born in Fukuoka City, Sawara County, as the second son of Chokunai HAYASHI, a feudal retainer of Fukuoka Domain and instructor of gun shooting.

sen.j: 1865年 福岡藩・銃術指導方に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1865, he was appointed a trainer of gun shooting at Fukuoka Domain.
sen.cmt: 指導方→trainer と訳しました。定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1865, he was appointed a trainer of gun shooting at Fukuoka Domain.
In 1865, he was appointed a trainer of gun shooting at Fukuoka Domain.

sen.j: 1868年 観光隊分隊司令官に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed a squad commander of Kanko-tai.
sen.cmt: 観光隊→Kanko-tai としました。詳細、定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1868, he was appointed a squad commander of Kanko-tai.
In 1868, he was appointed a squad commander of Kanko-tai.

sen.j: 1869年 銃砲曹少属火薬製造担当に任ぜられ、那珂郡 (筑前国)那珂川町 (福岡県)勤務となる。
sen.e: In 1869, he was assigned to Shosakan (Junior clerk) of Juhoso (gunnery division) and became in charge of manufacturing gunpowder, and he started working in Nakagawa-machi, Naka County (Chikuzen Province) (Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 銃砲曹少属→Shosakan (Junior cleark) of Juhoso (gunnery division) と訳しました。定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1869, he was assigned to Shosakan (Junior clerk) of Juhoso (gunnery division) and became in charge of manufacturing gunpowder, and he started working in Nakagawa-machi, Naka County (Chikuzen Province) (Fukuoka Prefecture).

In 1869, he was assigned to Shosakan (Junior clerk) of Juhoso (gunnery division) and became in charge of manufacturing gunpowder, and he started working in Nakagawa-machi, Naka County (Chikuzen Province) (Fukuoka Prefecture).

sen.j: 1870年 鋳砲方仕準拾五等となる。
sen.e: In 1870, he was assigned to Ihogata (department in charge of casting cannon) and given the semi 15th grade.
sen.cmt: 鋳砲方→Ihogata (department in charge of casting cannon) と訳しました。定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1870, he was assigned to Ihogata (department in charge of casting cannon) and given the semi 15th grade.
In 1870, he was assigned to Ihogata (department in charge of casting cannon) and given the semi 15th grade.

sen.j: 1871年 依願免職により藩職を辞し、早良郡福岡市に帰農。
sen.e: In 1871, he resigned the position at the Domain, and returned to Fukuoka City, Sawara County.
sen.cmt: 早良郡福岡市→”早良郡（福岡市）”かとも思われますが、原文通り訳しました。
sen.e: In 1871, he resigned the position at the Domain, and returned to Fukuoka City, Sawara County to farm.
sen.cmt: 原文の「帰農」の部分を訳出するためto farmを補足しました。
sen.e: In 1871, he resigned the position at the Domain, and returned to Fukuoka City, Sawara County to farm.

sen.j: 1877年 農業試験の経験に基づき、『勧農新書』初版を発行。
sen.e: In 1877, based on his experiences in agricultural experiments, he issued the first edition of "Kanno Shinsho".
In 1877, based on his experiences in agricultural experiments, he issued the first edition of "Kanno Shinsho".
In 1877, based on his experiences in agricultural experiments, he issued the first edition of "Kanno Shinsho".

sen.j: 1879年 私塾・興産社を設立。
sen.e: In 1879, he founded a private school, Kosansha.
In 1879, he founded a private school, Kosansha.
In 1879, he founded a private school, Kosansha.

sen.j: 1881年 第2回内国勧業博覧会への出展、第1回全国農談会出席、加筆の上で『勧農新書』再版を発行。
sen.e: In 1881, he participated in the second National Industrial Exhibition and attended the first Zenkoku Nodan-kai (national agricultural meeting), and published the reprint edition of "Kanno Shinsho".
sen.cmt: 全国農談会→Zenkoku Nodan-kai (national agricultural meeting) と訳しました。定訳不明です。
sen.e: In 1881, he participated in the second National Industrial Exhibition and attended the first Zenkoku Nodan-kai (national agricultural meeting), and published the reprint edition of "Kanno Shinsho".
In 1881, he participated in the second National Industrial Exhibition and attended the first Zenkoku Nodan-kai (national agricultural meeting), and published the reprint edition of "Kanno Shinsho".

sen.j: 1882年 農業指導のため長崎県へ出張巡回。
sen.e: In 1882, he travelled around Nagasaki Prefecture to provide agricultural trainings.
In 1882, he travelled around Nagasaki Prefecture to provide agricultural trainings.
In 1882, he travelled around Nagasaki Prefecture to provide agricultural trainings.

sen.j: 1884年 石川県・富山県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1884, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture and Toyama Prefecture.
In 1884, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture and Toyama Prefecture.
In 1884, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture and Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: 1885年 石川県・鳥取県・新潟県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1885, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture and Niigata Prefecture.
In 1885, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture and Niigata Prefecture.
In 1885, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture and Niigata Prefecture.

sen.j: 1886年 石川県・鳥取県・広島県・山口県・京都府で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1886, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Yamaguchi Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
In 1886, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Yamaguchi Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.
In 1886, he made lectures traveling around Ishikawa Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Yamaguchi Prefecture and Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1887年 私塾・勧農社設立、山口県・広島県・島根県・高知県・京都府・石川県・福井県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1887, he founded a private school, Kannosha, and made lectures traveling around Yamaguchi Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Shimane Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Ishikawa Prefecture and Fukui Prefecture.

In 1887, he founded a private school, Kannosha, and made lectures traveling around Yamaguchi Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Shimane Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Ishikawa Prefecture and Fukui Prefecture.

In 1887, he founded a private school, Kannosha, and made lectures traveling around Yamaguchi Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Shimane Prefecture, Kochi Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Ishikawa Prefecture and Fukui Prefecture.

sen.j: 1888年 京都府・鳥取県・広島県・大阪府・愛知県・岐阜県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1888, he made lectures traveling around Kyoto Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
In 1888, he made lectures traveling around Kyoto Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
In 1888, he made lectures traveling around Kyoto Prefecture, Tottori Prefecture, Hiroshima Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 1889年 農商務省 (日本)よりドイツ・ハンブルク港商業博覧会での出品説明委員およびドイツ・フランス・アメリカ合衆国・インド・ベトナムにおける農業視察を任ぜられ洋行。
sen.e: In 1889, he travelled to Western countries, as he was assigned by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan) to an exhibition attendant at Hamburg Industrial Exhibition in Germany, as well as to have an agricultural study tour to Germany, France, the United States of America, India and Vietnam.

In 1889, he travelled to Western countries, as he was assigned by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan) to an exhibition attendant at Hamburg Industrial Exhibition in Germany, as well as to have an agricultural study tour to Germany, France, the United States of America, India and Vietnam.

In 1889, he travelled to Western countries, as he was assigned by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce (Japan) to an exhibition attendant at Hamburg Industrial Exhibition in Germany, as well as to have an agricultural study tour to Germany, France, the United States of America, India and Vietnam.

sen.j: 1890年 愛知県・宮城県・福島県・愛媛県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1890, he made lectures traveling around Aichi Prefecture, Miyagi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture and Ehime Prefecture.
In 1890, he made lectures traveling around Aichi Prefecture, Miyagi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture and Ehime Prefecture.
In 1890, he made lectures traveling around Aichi Prefecture, Miyagi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture and Ehime Prefecture.

sen.j: 1891年 鳥取県・栃木県・福島県・岡山県・京都府・滋賀県・香川県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1891, he made lectures traveling around Tottori Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture, Okayama Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture and Kagawa Prefecture.
In 1891, he made lectures traveling around Tottori Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture, Okayama Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture and Kagawa Prefecture.
In 1891, he made lectures traveling around Tottori Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Fukushima prefecture, Okayama Prefecture, Kyoto Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture and Kagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 1892年 香川県・愛知県・岐阜県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1892, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
In 1892, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.
In 1892, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture, Aichi Prefecture and Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 1894年 宮城県・富山県・和歌山県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1894, he made lectures traveling around Miyagi Prefecture, Toyama Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture.
In 1894, he made lectures traveling around Miyagi Prefecture, Toyama Prefecture and Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 1895年 静岡県・長野県・青森県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1895, he made lectures traveling around Shizuoka Prefecture, Nagano Prefecture and Aomori Prefecture.
In 1895, he made lectures traveling around Shizuoka Prefecture, Nagano Prefecture and Aomori Prefecture.
In 1895, he made lectures traveling around Shizuoka Prefecture, Nagano Prefecture and Aomori Prefecture.

sen.j: 1896年 岡山県で巡回演説。
sen.e: In 1896, he made lectures traveling around Okayama Prefecture.
In 1896, he made lectures traveling around Okayama Prefecture.
In 1896, he made lectures traveling around Okayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 1897年～1898年 香川県で巡回演説。
sen.e: From 1897 to 1898, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture
From 1897 to 1898, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture
From 1897 to 1898, he made lectures traveling around Kagawa Prefecture

sen.j: 1899年～1901年 熊本県で巡回演説。
sen.e: From 1899 to 1901, he made lectures traveling around Kumamoto Prefecture.
From 1899 to 1901, he made lectures traveling around Kumamoto Prefecture.
From 1899 to 1901, he made lectures traveling around Kumamoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 1906年 気管支カタル性炎症により死亡。
sen.e: In 1906, he died of bronchial catarrhal inflammation.
In 1906, he died of bronchial catarrhal inflammation.
